x = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
y = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14]

# Resize your graph
plt.figure(figsize=(5, 3), dpi=100)

plt.plot(x, y, label="2x", color="red", linewidth=2, marker=".", linestyle="-.", markersize=30, markeredgecolor="blue")

# Another line plot
x2 = np.arange(0, 4.5, 0.5)


plt.plot(x2, x2**2,label="square of x", color="red")
plt.title("First Graph", fontdict={'fontname': 'Comic Sans MS', 'fontsize':30})
plt.xlabel("X axis", fontdict={'fontname': 'Comic Sans MS', 'fontsize':20})
plt.ylabel("Y axis", fontdict={'fontname': 'Comic Sans MS', 'fontsize':20})

plt.xticks([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7])
# plt.yticks([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7])
plt.legend()

# IF you want to save the graph uncomment this
# plt.savefig("firstgraph.png", dpi=300)

plt.show()
